Package graphics

Class Renderer

java.lang.Object
graphics.Renderer
public class Renderer extends Object
A custom "wrapper class" for the Graphics2D object. Renderer allows more functionality and readability than just using Graphics2D by itself. (extending Graphics2D is not an option, because for some reason many of the methods must be implemented manually)

      Graphics2D g

  • Constructor Details

    • Renderer

      public Renderer​(Graphics2D g)
      Creates the renderer with the passed in Graphics2D object.

  • Method Details

    • scale

      public void scale​(int x, int y)
      Scales the renderer by the specified dimensions.

    • clearRect

      public void clearRect​(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Clears an area of graphics specified by the parameters.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of this graphics context and releasesany system resources that it is using.

    • setFont

      public void setFont​(Font font)
      Sets this graphics context's font to the specified font. All subsequent text operations using this graphics context use this font. A null argument is silently ignored.

    • drawString

      public void drawString​(String s, float x, float y)
      Renders a string of text using the renderer's current font. The first character is positioned at the x and y coords, and it continues rendering the whole string to the right.

    • drawOutlinedString

      public void drawOutlinedString​(String s, float x, float y, Color innerColour, int thickness)
      Renders a string of text using the renderer's current font but with a stroke around the characters. The current colour of the graphics context is used for the outline.
      Parameters:
      innerColour - The inner colour of the characters, not the outline.
      thickness - The thickness in pixels of the outline.

    • drawImage

      public void drawImage​(BufferedImage image, float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Renders a BufferedImage to the screen and scales it to fit inside a rectangle of specified dimensions.

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(double radians, float x, float y)
      Rotates the graphics by a specified number of radians around a pivot that is specified by x and y coordinates. The rotation applies to subsequent graphics calls.

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(Color c)
      Sets this graphics context's font to the specified font. All subsequent text operations using this graphics context use this font.

    • setStroke

      public void setStroke​(int thickness)
      Sets the stroke of the graphics context to a BasicStroke with a specified thickness in pixels.

    • drawLine

      public void drawLine​(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2)
      Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the graphic's current stroke and colour.

    • fillRect

      public void fillRect​(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Fills in a rectangle of the specified position and dimensions.

    • drawRect

      public void drawRect​(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws the outline of a rectangle of the specified position and dimensions.

    • getFontMetrics

      public FontMetrics getFontMetrics()
      Returns the current font metrics of the graphic context.

    • drawWrappedString

      public void drawWrappedString​(String s, float x, float y, int maxWidth)
      Draws a string but wraps it around to a new line once the width reaches a specified maximum in pixels.

    • setTransparency

      public void setTransparency​(float alpha)
      Changes the transparency of the graphics.
      Parameters:
      alpha - Must be from 0-1, with 0 being transparent and 1 being opaque

    • fillOval

      public void fillOval​(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Fills in a oval of the specified position and dimensions.
